chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ura E Giengerich

records.addlTxt:
Jury status hearing on November 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial on December 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

3:40 PM 22CF147 & 22CF148 cases called
Defendant Ura E Giengerich appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Ura E Giengerich.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Richards states waiver of preliminary hearing forms have been e-filed

Court reviews waiver of preliminary hearing and questionnaire form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing, and binds def. over for further proceedings

Information filed at this time

Atty Richards waives reading of information, enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts in both cases
Clerk is directed to enter NOT GUILTY pleas in both cases
Jury status hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
11:20 AM Defendant Ura E Giengerich appeared by video.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Ura E Giengerich.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

22CF147 and 22CF148 called, 22TR853 to track along.

Attorney Richards is heard and is willing to take both cases.  

22CF147 - Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 
22CF148 - Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 

22CF148 Bond
State requests a $500.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement. 

Attorney Richards is heard and requests the $500.00 cash cover both cases. 

Court orders a $500.00 cash bond for 22CF148. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

2:04 PM Defendant Ura E Giengerich appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court has reviewed probable cause statement and does find prob. cause - will address bond
DA indicates he has not seen probable cause statement - Court screen shares document for his review
 
Atty. Steiner is heard on issue of bond - requests $1000.00 cash bond with conditions: Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Court orders $500.00 cash bond - with the following conditions:
Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.

Right to counsel explained
Hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 11:15 am.

Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.
